column2: IDESLABS PRIVATE LIMITED is looking for Pascal /Delphi Developer to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As a Pascal/Delphi Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, and maintaining software applications using Pascal and Delphi programming languages      This role involves collaborating with a development team, understanding project requirements, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality, efficient, and reliable software solutions        Key Responsibilities:        Software Development:Write, modify, and debug software applications using Pascal and Delphi      Develop efficient and maintainable code to meet project requirements      System Design:Collaborate with stakeholders and software architects to design robust and scalable software systems      Participate in system design discussions and provide input based on expertise      Code Optimization:Optimize code for performance and resource utilization      Conduct regular code reviews to ensure adherence to coding standards      Application Testing:Create and execute unit tests to verify the functionality and reliability of developed software      Collaborate with quality assurance teams to address reported issues      User Interface (UI) Development:Design and implement user interfaces using Delphi's visual component library      Ensure a positive and user-friendly experience for application users      Database Integration:Integrate applications with databases using Delphi's database components      Implement data access and manipulation functionalities      Documentation:Create and maintain technical documentation for software applications      Document code, APIs, and system architecture for future reference      Collaboration:Work closely with other developers, software engineers, and project managers      Participate in team meetings, providing updates on progress and challenges      Version Control:Utilize version control systems, such as Git, to manage and track changes to the codebase      Ensure code consistency and collaborate effectively in a team environment      Continuous Learning:Stay updated on industry trends, new features in Pascal and Delphi, and best practices      Explore opportunities to enhance skills and knowledge in related technologies

column2: An Application Support Professional is an individual who provides technical assistance and support for software applications used within an organization or by end-users. They play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth functioning of software applications and addressing any issues that arise. Responsibilities of an Application Support Professional typically include: Troubleshooting: Identifying and resolving software application issues reported by users or discovered through monitoring systems. User Support: Assisting end-users with technical questions, providing guidance on how to use software applications, and troubleshooting user-reported problems. Incident Management: Managing and documenting incidents, including prioritizing and escalating issues as necessary to ensure timely resolution. Software Maintenance: Performing routine maintenance tasks such as applying patches, updates, and configuration changes to keep applications running smoothly. Root Cause Analysis: Investigating the underlying causes of recurring or critical issues and working to prevent their recurrence. Documentation: Maintaining accurate documentation of known issues, troubleshooting steps, and resolutions to aid in future problem-solving and knowledge sharing. Collaboration: Collaborating with software developers, system administrators, and other IT teams to resolve complex issues, provide feedback on software performance, and contribute to process improvements. Training and Support Materials: Developing training materials and providing training sessions to users, helping them understand the features and functionality of software applications. Monitoring and Performance Optimization: Monitoring application performance, identifying potential bottlenecks, and suggesting optimizations to improve overall performance and stability.
column11: Root cause analysis, Application support, Production support, Incident management, Performance optimization, User support, Support Professional, Troubleshooting, Application software, Monitoring

column2: Are you a SQL-savvy person passionate about troubleshooting and fixing data and performance in complex production databases?? Would you like to be part of a core team that works directly with customers and solves their critical problems live? High-level requirements for this position: Highly skilled in SQL Development. Customer Support Experience or Capability to talk to Customers and understand the context. Work directly on production SQL systems. Good communication and documentation skills. Must work in US business hours. (8 AM to 5 PM Pacific Time) 5+ years of work experience in SQL development. What You Will Do Are you a motivated SQL expert with demonstrated experience working on SQL databases to troubleshoot data and performance problems? If so, Trimble Viewpoint seeks people like you to join our highly skilled and talented group. You will be a SQL support specialist responsible for resolving SQL data-related and reports-related issues, monitoring, and tuning performance in self-hosted and cloud-deployed Trimble Viewpoint environments. In addition, this role serves as a support liaison between Trimble Viewpoint, third-party vendors, and our customers.? Provide telephone and Internet support to customers with questions or issues related to configuration/setup, product functionality (attachments, scanning, printing, exporting), performance, and hosted software services, including SQL data and reports-related problems. Troubleshoot and solve technical issues, including system performance, permissions, data inconsistency, and application errors. Provide expertise in SQL Data Manipulation and Administration (back-ups, maintenance plans, user administration) for all Viewpoint product suites. Assist customers with software upgrades, migration, and transformation. Assist other departments with technical issues. Monitors, tracks, and documents customer support calls and activities in the CRM system. Effectively document issues/feedback from customers for use by Development in research and resolution of defects. Develops Knowledge Base articles to document troubleshooting steps and standard solutions to frequent calls for use by customers and peers. Implement performance optimizations suggested by the engineering personnel. Respond to alerts and help monitor, tune, and configure Non-Production and Production monitoring for the best sustainable performance. Follow documented processes for troubleshooting, engagement, escalation, and others with 3rd-party hosting partners. Research and diagnose issues independently or as a team. Support after-hours and on-call duties as required. What Skills & Experience Should You Bring Demonstrated experience troubleshooting SQL, including tables, triggers, views, stored procedures, performance tuning, and ability to write complex SQL queries in Microsoft Transact SQL.? Demonstrated experience with Crystal Reports, including sub-reports, running totals, linking tables, and troubleshooting. Deep understanding and working knowledge of Microsoft Reporting Services or Financial Statements Reporting applications. Sound knowledge of SQL Server Database Administration and relational database concepts. Experience in cloud-based environments such as AWS, Azure, or IaaS-based providers. Experience with remote desktop takeover tools (Example: Zoom, WebEx, GoToMeeting, Bomgar). Soft Skills include communication, teamwork, adaptability, problem-solving, creativity, work Ethics, interpersonal skills, and time management. Familiarity with the commercial construction industry (Job costing, Payroll, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Equipment Tracking, and Project Management) is an asset for this position but optional. Trimbles Inclusiveness Commitment We believe in celebrating our differences. That is why our diversity is our strength. To us, that means actively participating in opportunities to be inclusive. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion have guided our current success while moving our desire to improve. We actively seek to add members to our community who represent our customers and the places we live and work. We have programs in place to ensure our people are seen, heard, and welcomed and most importantly, they know they belong, no matter who they are or where they are coming from.

column2: Highly skilled in SQL Development.             Customer Support Experience or Capability to talk to Customers and understand the context.             Work directly on production SQL systems.             Good communication and documentation skills.             Must work in US business hours. (8 AM to 5 PM Pacific Time)             5+ years of work experience in SQL development.                     What You Will Do             Are you a motivated SQL expert with demonstrated experience working on SQL databases to troubleshoot data and performance problems? If so, Trimble Viewpoint seeks people like you to join our highly skilled and talented group     You will be a SQL support specialist responsible for resolving SQL data-related and reports-related issues, monitoring, and tuning performance in self-hosted and cloud-deployed Trimble Viewpoint environments     In addition, this role serves as a support liaison between Trimble Viewpoint, third-party vendors, and our customers                      Provide telephone and Internet support to customers with questions or issues related to configuration/setup, product functionality (attachments, scanning, printing, exporting), performance, and hosted software services, including SQL data and reports-related problems.             Troubleshoot and solve technical issues, including system performance, permissions, data inconsistency, and application errors.             Provide expertise in SQL Data Manipulation and Administration (back-ups, maintenance plans, user administration) for all Viewpoint product suites.             Assist customers with software upgrades, migration, and transformation.             Assist other departments with technical issues.             Monitors, tracks, and documents customer support calls and activities in the CRM system.             Effectively document issues/feedback from customers for use by Development in research and resolution of defects.             Develops Knowledge Base articles to document troubleshooting steps and standard solutions to frequent calls for use by customers and peers.             Implement performance optimizations suggested by the engineering personnel.             Respond to alerts and help monitor, tune, and configure Non-Production and Production monitoring for the best sustainable performance.             Follow documented processes for troubleshooting, engagement, escalation, and others with 3rd-party hosting partners.             Research and diagnose issues independently or as a team.             Support after-hours and on-call duties as required.             What Skills & Experience Should You Bring             Demonstrated experience troubleshooting SQL, including tables, triggers, views, stored procedures, performance tuning, and ability to write complex SQL queries in Microsoft Transact SQL.              Demonstrated experience with Crystal Reports, including sub-reports, running totals, linking tables, and troubleshooting.             Deep understanding and working knowledge of Microsoft Reporting Services or Financial Statements Reporting applications.             Sound knowledge of SQL Server Database Administration and relational database concepts.             Experience in cloud-based environments such as AWS, Azure, or IaaS-based providers.             Experience with remote desktop takeover tools (Example: Zoom, WebEx, GoToMeeting, Bomgar).             Soft Skills include communication, teamwork, adaptability, problem-solving, creativity, work Ethics, interpersonal skills, and time management.             Familiarity with the commercial construction industry (Job costing, Payroll, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Equipment Tracking, and Project Management) is an asset for this position but optional.             bachelors degree, preferably major in computer science or relevant experience.

column2: ABCloudz is looking for an experienced Senior SQL Server Engineer to join our star team. We are looking for engineers with a strong understanding of the full data development lifecycle, including requirements gathering, solution design, development, and production deployment. The ideal candidate will have a solid knowledge of SQL Server database engine with the desire and passion to continue honing these skills.           Responsibilities          Design, implement, and maintain database systems that are performant, scalable, resilient, and secure.          Build logging, monitoring, alerting, and automation solutions to aid in the quick detection and resolution of production database issues.          Promote database best practices to our engineering teams through participation in code and architecture reviews.          Develop robust data backup and restore processes that ensure we never lose data.          Provide database development environments that allow for quick and easy testing of new features and expose bugs before they are shipped.          Perform regular database upgrades, maintenance, and tuning.          Qualifications      The experience and qualifications we hope you bring to the Senior SQL Server Engineer position:         7 years of experience administering SQL Server databases.          4 years of experience designing and managing SQL Server database engines.          Strong understanding of database internals with the ability to diagnose performance issues and design scalable data access patterns.          Experience working with application developers to tune SQL queries for improved performance.          Expertise in managing OLTP databases in a high-tech environment.          Practice working in a clustered environment with quorum-level knowledge.          Proficiency in writing SQL, inspecting query plans, and improving query performance.          Experience with at least one scripting language such as SQL and PowerShell.          In-depth knowledge of a dynamic DevOps environment.         Familiarity with industry-standard practices around secure database credential storage, access, and rotation.          Understanding of cloud-hosted services such as AWS or Azure.          Preferred Qualifications        Experience working with other components of SQL Server (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, etc.)         Practice of managing storage         Expertise in managing VMs         Understanding of other database engines

Candidates who can join immediately or within a short notice of 15 days are preferred. Key Responsibilities: 1. Develop and optimize SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data from relational databases. 2. Design and implement database structures, tables, and views to support data analysis and reporting requirements. 3. Utilize SAS or Python for statistical analysis, data manipulation, and modeling tasks, such as regression analysis, clustering, and predictive modeling. 4. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions. 5. Perform data cleaning, validation, and quality assurance to ensure the accuracy and integrity of datasets. 6. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field. 2. Proven experience as a SQL programmer, with expertise in writing complex SQL queries and working with relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL). 3. Strong proficiency in SAS or Python programming, with experience in statistical analysis, data manipulation, and modeling. 4. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail. 5. Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. 6. Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.

column2: This role is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly motivated global team of Database Engineers, working on critical projects across multiple database systems.          The Senior Database Engineer will play a critical role in filling a gap between Database Operations and Development Teams.          While tuning and monitoring performance of our extensive database stack will be the primary focus of this role, there will be many opportunities to extend one s skills into other areas.          Extensive training and growth opportunities will be provided, but the candidate should be able to demonstrate high level of competency in SQL and knowledge of inner workings of various database server components.          We are ideally looking for a candidate who is willing to learn and grow in a highly supportive team work environment.          Currently the team consists of 10 members in various geographical regions looking after SQL Server, MySQL/MariaDB, Cassandra and Couchbase both on-premise and in the cloud.                  Key Responsibilities                  Performance tune SQL queries using industry standard monitoring solutions              Offer expertise and guidance on code optimization              Troubleshoot database Server issues and performance bottlenecks              Produce clear documentation for delivered solutions              Work closely with Development teams (and be their point of contract for performance related enquiries)              Contribute to and maintain system standards          Research and recommend innovative, and where applicable automate approaches for system administrations tasks              Perform daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all hardware, server resources, systems, and key processes, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs              Repair and recover from hardware or software failures. Coordinate and communication with impacted stakeholders.              Perform on-going performance tuning, and resource optimization as required. Configure CPU, memory, and disk partitions as required                  Essential skills:                  Proficiency in query tuning using T-SQL              Be able to understand and discuss query plans              Good understanding of performance tuning best practices              Good understanding of inner workings of SQL Server engine              AWS or Azure cloud experience                  Optional:                  Experience with at least one of the following Database Management Systems:              MariaDB/MySQL              Cassandra              Couchbase              Automations and scripting (PowerShell, Python or any other)              Data Warehouse (either reporting or ETL side)                      What Diligent Offers You            Creativity is ingrained in our culture.    We are innovative collaborators by nature. We thrive in exploring how things can be differently both in our internal processes and to help our clients        We care about our people.    Diligent offers a flexible work environment, global days of service, comprehensive health benefits, meeting free days, generous time off policy and wellness programs to name a few        We have teams all over the world    . We may be headquartered in New York City, but we have office hubs in Washington D.C., Vancouver, London, Galway, Budapest, Munich, Bengaluru, Singapore, and Sydney.        Diversity is important to us.    Growing, maintaining and promoting a diverse team is a top priority for us. We foster and encourage diversity through our Employee Resource Groups and provide access to resources and education to support the education of our team, facilitate dialogue, and foster understanding
column11: Performance tuning, Powershell, cassandra, MySQL, System monitoring, SQL, Python, Recruitment

column2: We      are currently looking for an exceptional      Staff      DevOps Database Engineer      ,      to join our mission, to improve human health by unlocking the power of the genome.                      As      Staff      DevOps      Database        Engineer,    you will      be responsible for      the      DB      management of      highly available      and resilient      database infrastructure      on one or more leading cloud      platform, including AWS, Azure and GCP. Essentially, you      will be able to      work in a dynamic, collaborative regional team and will be comfortable liaising with internal and external stakeholders. Work within and enforce security and regulatory compliance procedures      .                      Developing,      managing      and testing database backup and recovery plans. Perform database preventive maintenance and execute annual DR exercise.                      Document and communicate procedures, workflows, and standards effectively.                      Take ownership to drive initiatives and issues to conclusion.                          Preferred background, skills, and experience:                          Minimum 8 years of relevant experience; with 5+ years supporting      at least      3      of these      database      platforms:      M      S      SQL      S      erver      , MySQL, PostgreSQL      , MongoDB      , Snowflake, SAP Hana,          5+ years of expertise with Windows and Linux server platforms, and          2+ years of experience      with automation tools such as Ansible, Terraform      in CI/CD      methodology      .                      Expertise in troubleshooting      DB servers problems and performance      .                      Knowledge of cloud database platforms      , preferably      AWS RDS      /      Aurora      .                      Deep knowledge of SQL and its dialects.                      Demonstrated knowledge      of scripting and programming languages such as Bash,      PowerShell,      and Python      .                  Be able to work in AMR time zones on a consistent basis. column2: Job Summary: Manage a team are of hybrid analyst-developers who create and support a range of in-house applications and End User Compliant (EUC) solutions, most frequently for Product Control and wider Finance and Regulatory teams. Work alongside larger transformational programme like Aspire, using their skills and infrastructure to provide tactical last-mile solutions and to build working prototypes in advance of strategic deliveries. Drive maintenance, administration and optimization of in house  infrastructure which comprises Windows servers running SQL, SSAS and SSIS with additional visualization software's like the on-premise version Power BI. Understand strategic technology stack integration requirements and re purpose / align inhouse applications requirements and evolution to the strategic stack Drive technology offering on front to back process automation, which is intended to be built on a scalable cloud-based platform, using intelligent entity management and data modelling, and reporting via visualization tools. This should give users a fast and efficient interface to interrogate large datasets with a complex set of input parameters. The Team is based in three main locations  London, Singapore and seeking to expand further in Bangalore. Role & Responsibilities:   Successful candidates will be highly proficient in SQL and have extensive experience working with related SQL products (SSIS, SSAS MD, SSAS Tabular) and be comfortable building, supporting and enhancing applications to meet the user requirements. Manage and drive oversight on BAU support for the RAD platform (in house applications) There is a BI element to the role, so a good knowledge of multi-dimensional and tabular models is preferred, alongside experience of popular BI tools like Power BI, Tableau and/or Qlikview Candidates are expected to be comfortable working directly with the users to understand requirements, offer strategic advice and rapidly iterate through versions of the solution Candidates are also expected to be able to support Business-As-Usual (BAU) activities, gaining a good initial understanding from on-the-job training/wiki and then quickly investigating and resolving issues across the Rapid Team applications, on a timely basis. Be Functional and hands on with above technologies across development, implementation, and administration / maintenance. Work closely hands on with the team members to scale their functional abilities and help with their deliveries.    Business Knowledge:   The teams work will primarily support Finance and Product Control. Some knowledge of Financial Markets, Finance or Product Control would be preferable but not essential.   Technology Requirements:  Extensive in depth knowledge of SQL and SAS  development / maintenance and administration  Good understanding of database maintenance (backups, indexes) Good understanding of Windows-based security (Local Windows Groups/Domain Groups), along with SSAS role-based security Practical experience working with SSIS, developing and managing robust ETL processes. A good understanding and practical experience of entity management and data modelling within a BI/MIS context Familiarity with BI tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, Qlikview or Microstrategy Knowledge and understanding of web-development would be useful Familiarity with SAP and its environment will be an added advantage Preferred candidate profile:   Master's / Bachelor's of Computer Science or Computer Engineering from a top tier university or Equivalent Experience 10+ years of professional programming experience. Python experience preferred. Work related experience using a functional language. Alternatively strong interest on functional programming will also be considered Ability to learn and become a full stack developer on web based Django Framework.? Knowledge of relational databases.? The ability to write efficient, clear code and to articulate what has been implemented and why is essential. Rapid application development style of work experience is desirable. Knowledge of market data in financial markets or financial knowledge is desirable.? Experience of Market data providers including Reuters, Bloomberg, Markit etc is desirable. Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate at all levels both written and verbally for understanding requirements ?and showcasing implementations. Preferred skills: Python,Django, SQL Server, HTML/CSS/Javascript, Power BI If you're a candidate and want to challenge us,  please apply through a link given here . https://jobs.standardchartered.com/job/Bangalore-VP%2C-PC-Technology-Lead/793857002/?feedId=362857&utm_source=CareerSite Job Location - Bangalore

MongoDB, Elasticsearch)                                 Knowledge of common programming languages, in particular C# and javascript. Python is a plus                                   Nice to have                             :                                Knowledge of Business Intelligence, Analytics and ETL is a plus;                                 Knowledge of application hosting and deployment in the cloud (Azure, GCP or AWS);                                 Knowledge of Behavior Driven Development is a plus

column2: Pricewaterhouse Coopers Private Limited  is looking for Senior Associate - EA- Oracle  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    Oracle Implementation and Configuration:        Lead or participate in Oracle implementation projects, including gathering business requirements, designing system architecture, and configuring Oracle applications to meet business needs.      Customize Oracle applications using configuration tools, application extensions, and scripting languages to address specific business requirements.        System Integration and Data Migration:        Integrate Oracle applications with other enterprise systems, databases, and third-party applications to ensure seamless data flow and process automation.      Develop data migration strategies and scripts to migrate data from legacy systems to Oracle applications, ensuring data integrity and consistency.        System Administration and Support:        Provide day-to-day support for Oracle applications, including user management, security configuration, system monitoring, and performance tuning.      Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Oracle applications, working closely with technical teams and vendors to implement solutions.        Upgrade and Enhancement Projects:        Plan and execute Oracle application upgrades, patches, and enhancements to leverage new features and capabilities.      Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify opportunities for system improvements and develop enhancement proposals.        Documentation and Knowledge Sharing:        Document system configurations, technical designs, and support procedures for Oracle applications.      Provide training and knowledge transfer to end-users and technical teams to ensure effective utilization of Oracle applications.

column2: Sr Database Engineer Bangalore, Karnataka, India JOB DESCRIPTION Day to day responsibilities of the role include, but are not limited to:   Maintains multiple database management systems in  database design, testing implementation, maintenance and administration  in a multiple platform environment contributing to policy and procedure development. Maintains and monitors database utilities, the relationships between the database users and applications, uses query languages to design required summary or aggregation tables to support analyses. Backups/Restore, User Access Management (creating users, privileges, roles, quotas, table, indexes etc.), space management, monitoring (alert log, memory, disk I/O, CPU, database network connectivity) Reviewing functional requirements to resolve issues related to information flow and content.  Defining database security policies and maintaining the standards across all the environments. Optimize database architecture schema and structures, to include files, tables, and table spaces and provide tuning and performance of the application database environment. Work closely with developers, provide DBA support for multiple applications in development, Test, QA, UAT and production environments. The individual will also be required to work on scripting tools like T-SQL and PowerShell at an application level. Perform proactive database system tuning services, ensuring a high-performance platform that will meet business needs. Keep up to date on industry trends and methodologies for and make recommendations on incorporation into the Company's database system infrastructure. Proactively identify symptoms and instabilities in a timely and accurate manner to include performing analysis, capacity planning, and testing for organizations environment Provide written documentation to support the recommendation and benefits of implementing new technology. QUALIFICATIONS Education Bachelors degree in computer science, MIS, or a related field required, however equivalent work experience in a similar position may be substituted for educational requirements.    Industry relevant certifications are highly desirable. Experience Minimum 8years of relevant experience in Microsoft SQL Server Database administration required. Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.  Ability to perform in a dynamic, fast-changing work environment. Technical Skills: - SQL installations, upgrade/Migrations, and configuration for SQL server 2008 to SQL Server 2019 and troubleshooting installation issues. Creation of the SQL logins and users, access provision as per the requirement. Configuration of database mirroring, Log shipping and troubleshooting issues. Configuration of Always on availability groups with multi subnet and troubleshooting AG issues and performing the failovers. Configuration of Transaction replication and troubleshooting for replication issues, knowledge, and hands on other replication topologies. Installation and configuration of SQL server clustering and troubleshooting the SQL cluster issues. SQL performance tuning and Query optimization, knowledge on backup tools like TDP and semantic net backup SQL patching such as applying service packs, security patches and Hotfixes. Must have the SQL Development knowledge to assist the developers for fine tuning and performance trouble shooting to ensure a high-performance platformthat will meet business needs The ability to perform the design and development of the new features of the SQL server as POC and recommending them to the existing infrastructure. Configuration and Migration of AWS/Azure cloud databasesfrom on premise databases and Maintenance support. Knowledge on MySQL Databases ITIL Process awareness with Incident Management, Change Management, Problem Management Provide subject matter expert level knowledge to the team and customer as needed. Legacy MS Access based reports and often broken when underlying DB schema is changed.          Candidate must have production database experience assistance to fix the schema broken issues and syn with source database systems. The target DataMart system needs some partition enhancements due to the bank data size is growing from the source systems and archive the data as needed.          Candidate will implement the database schema changes needed and provide production application support perspective. column1: Hiring!! Database Developer( PostgreSQL)_4+yrs | Available immediately
column2: We are currently seeking a 'Database Developer' with expertise in Schema Design, SQL development, backup and restore procedures, troubleshooting, and performance tuning, particularly with PostgreSQL and Microsoft SQL Server. In this role, you will be responsible for crafting and managing high-performance, robust, and modern applications that are compatible across different browsers and devices. You'll be joining a talented team comprising both front-end and back-end engineers, collaborating closely with product owners to ensure timely and quality implementations that enhance our product and delight our users. Our clients include top fortune 100 international technology companies. Job Profile and Responsibilities: As a key member of our development team, you will be responsible for leading the design, development, implementation, and maintenance of our Postgres database solutions along with MS SQL Servers. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience working with Postgres databases in complex environments and possess strong leadership skills to guide and mentor other team members. Below will be the Responsibilities: Lead the design, development, and optimization of Postgres database solutions to meet business requirements and performance goals. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze requirements, propose solutions, and implement database designs. Provide technical leadership and guidance to backend and front developers, ensuring best practices and standards are followed. Perform database administration tasks, including monitoring, tuning, and troubleshooting to ensure the integrity, security, and availability of databases. Design and implement database backup and recovery strategies to minimize downtime and data loss. Conduct performance tuning and optimization of SQL queries, indexes, and database configurations to improve application performance. Implement and maintain database security measures, including access controls, encryption, and auditing. Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in database development and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives. Collaborate with other teams to integrate database solutions with applications and systems, ensuring seamless functionality and data consistency. Create and maintain database schema, SQL queries, stored procedures, database indexes or other database-related artifacts. Document database design, architecture, and configurations, as well as processes and procedures for database administration and maintenance. Should Open to explore and work on other SQL and NO SQL databases like MS SQL Server and MongoDB Desired Profile: Proven experience as a database developer or engineer, with a focus on Postgres database development and administration. In-depth knowledge of Postgres database architecture, features, and capabilities. Strong proficiency in SQL programming and database query optimization. Experience with database design, modeling, and normalization techniques. Hands-on experience with database performance tuning, monitoring, and troubleshooting. Familiarity with database security best practices and compliance standards. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders. Experience in leading database development projects and mentoring junior team members is a plus. Highly organised Highly competent and diligent Quality Driven Experience with cloud database services (e.g., Amazon RDS, Google Cloud SQL) is a plus. Knowledge of other database technologies such as MySQL, Oracle, or SQL Server is beneficial. Opportunity To work on PostgreSQL, MS SQL, MySQL and No SQL Databases. Configure and manage databases on development and production environments. work with our awesome team get freedom to express and drive content initiatives. be the content leader! If you are interested, please share your CV at  career@mundrisoft.com . Thanks & Regards, HR Team

column2: About the Role   As a SQL Developer, you will play a pivotal role in managing, developing, and optimizing our databases and SQL Server instances. Your responsibilities will include creating and maintaining queries, reports, tables, stored procedures, and views to ensure efficient data management and retrieval.  Main responsibilities   Database Management:  Maintain, manage, and optimize SQL Server databases to ensure data integrity and availability. Query and Report Development:  Create and manage SQL queries and reports to extract meaningful insights from our data. Table and View Maintenance:  Design, modify, and maintain database tables and views for improved data organization. Stored Procedure Development:  Develop and optimize stored procedures for efficient data processing. Performance Optimization:  Continuously monitor and enhance database performance to meet business needs.  Minimum Requirements   SQL Expertise:  A minimum of 5 years of experience in SQL Server database development and administration. Query Optimization:  Strong proficiency in optimizing SQL queries for performance. Database Management:  Profound understanding of database management principles. Data Integrity:  Commitment to maintaining data integrity and security. Problem Solving:  Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot database issues. Team Collaboration:  Strong teamwork and communication skills for effective collaboration. SQL Server Knowledge:  Familiarity with SQL Server and its features. SQL Certifications:  Relevant certifications in SQL Server database development and administration are a plus. Preferred Skills  Windows Server Administration experience. To ensure a seamless work experience, the following workspace requirements must be met. Failure to comply with these requirements will result in an unsuccessful application. Workspace Requirements: A dedicated room, away from distractions, and not in a shared space Desktop Computer with 2 extra monitors with a minimum screen size of 24 inches Willingness to install an IP camera that provides live video and audio feed of your workplace during working hours Power backup in case of power outages Note: The IP camera and related peripherals will be provided by us.   Pay and Benefits: Annal salary & performance Review

column2: Project Role : Application Designer Project Role Description : Assist in defining requirements and designing applications to meet business process and application requirements.  Must have skills : Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) Good to have skills : NA Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Minimum 15 years of education Summary :As an Application Designer, you will be responsible for assisting in defining requirements and designing applications to meet business process and application requirements using Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS). Your typical day will involve working with the development team, analyzing business requirements, and designing and implementing SSIS packages.  Roles & Responsibilities: Design and develop SSIS packages to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into the target system. Collaborate with the development team to analyze business requirements and design and implement SSIS packages to meet those requirements. Create and maintain technical documentation related to SSIS packages, including design documents, test plans, and user manuals. Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to SSIS packages, including performance tuning and optimization. Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in SSIS development and integration. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Strong experience in Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS). Good To Have Skills:Experience in Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS). Experience in designing and developing ETL processes using SSIS. Strong understanding of database concepts and SQL programming. Experience in performance tuning and optimization of SSIS packages. Experience in troubleshooting and resolving issues related to SSIS packages. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS). The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful data-driven solutions. This position is based at our Coimbatore office. Qualification Minimum 15 years of education

column2: Project Role : Software Development Engineer Project Role Description : Analyze, design, code and test multiple components of application code across one or more clients. Perform maintenance, enhancements and/or development work.  Must have skills : Microsoft SQL Server Database Administration Good to have skills : NA Minimum  2  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : btech Summary :As a Software Development Engineer, you will be responsible for analyzing, designing, coding, and testing multiple components of application code across one or more clients. Roles & Responsibilities: Design, develop, and maintain Microsoft SQL Server databases. Perform database tuning and optimization to ensure optimal performance. Experience with database tuning and optimization techniques. Familiarity with database security best practices. Experience with database backup and recovery procedures. Solid grasp of SQL programming language. Experience with database monitoring and performance tuning tools. Experience with database migration and upgrade projects. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 2 years of experience in Microsoft SQL Server database administration. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful database solutions. This position is based at our Noida office. Qualification btech

The Client develops, manufactures, and sells?networking hardware,?software,?telecommunications equipment, and other?high-technology?services and products.?The Client specializes in specific tech markets, such as the?Internet of Things?(IoT),?domain security,?videoconferencing, and?energy management. It is one of the?largest technology companies?in the world, ranking 82nd on the?Fortune?100?with over $51 billion in revenue and nearly 83,300 employees. About The Job: A Database Developer who can create, implement and manage expansive database applications. Has experience in reviewing database performance implementing performance centric data base queries and stored procedures. Maintain responsibility for maintaining one or more complex databases. Analyze the design, development, and delivery or implementation of data solutions, including architecture design, prototyping of concepts to proof of concept, analysis of the development of standards, design, and test plans, code, module design development and testing, data solution debugging, design and implementation of a solution that follows efficient design techniques, and development that meets and exceeds the intent of the design of the data solution. Assist with the planning and engineering of the organization's databases.   Essential Job Functions: Experience with a development and maintenance of Logical and Physical database models. Actively developing PLSQL DDL, DDM scripts for large/complex data tables: 5+ years of experience for Database development. Experience with supporting Linux, Solaris, and Windows systems engineering efforts in system design and evaluation, solution engineering, software development, or system administration Experience with Database Schema as Code tools (e.g., Toad) Ability to design and develop complex SQL queries and reports to retrieve required data Ability to develop DDL and DDM to support changes to Postgres tables Experience with database partitioning and microservices Knowledge of Agile methodologies or the software development life cycle (SDLC) Experience with installation, maintenance, and administration of Postgres, Experience with installation, maintenance, and administration of Single-store similar Database , Experience analyzing and tuning queries to improve performance Experience configuring, integrating, patching, and securing Postgres database Experience with cloud exposure, preferable AWS - hands-on experience on projects where the DB is hosted in cloud (not OnPrem) Experience with DB evaluation across various offering products and solutions. Experience in evaluate and identify in-memory vs. disk usage and optimize. Exposure to handle big data / data mart / time-series DB will be a value add. Awareness on critical DB metrics to monitor and setup alerts. Bachelor's degree in computer science, electronics engineering or other engineering or technical discipline is required. 8 years of additional relevant experience may be substituted for education. Good You Have: Experience with code reviews on SQL change sets and work with developers to create and enforce best practices Exposure to security scanning tools, configuring their use and working with teams to fix vulnerabilities? Experience with ETL and Data Warehousing methods Experience with Replication technologies such as AWS DMS or Postgres How to Apply:  Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume using the apply online button on this job post. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Unlock Rewards: Refer Candidates and Earn. If you're not available or interested in this opportunity, please pass this along to anyone in your network who might be a good fit and interested in our open positions. VARITE offers a Candidate Referral program, where you'll receive a one-time referral bonus based on the following scale if the referred candidate completes a three-month assignment with VARITE. Exp Req  -  Referral Bonus 0 - 2 Yrs. - INR 5,000 2 - 6 Yrs. - INR 7,500 6 + Yrs. - INR 10,000 About VARITE:  VARITE is a global staffing and IT consulting company providing technical consulting and team augmentation services to Fortune 500 Companies in USA, UK, CANADA and INDIA. column2: CellPoint Digital is on a mission to make payments a strategic advantage for businesses.                 We are the global leader in payment orchestration, with innovative solutions that help clients like Virgin Atlantic take the right payment, at the right time, from customers in every local market - all in real-time to optimize their payment revenue. We simplify the complexity of 28+ card schemes (think MasterCard, Visa, American Express), 168+ alternative payment methods (think ApplePay, PayPal, Alipay), and 220+ processors (think Worldpay, Elavon, Union Pay) with a platform that combines the best of them all with intelligent routing that drives dramatic success and revenue savings for our clients.               We are a rapidly growing company driven by a talented team with diverse experiences and unique insights. Our community stretches across the globe with offices in Copenhagen, Dallas, Dubai, London, Miami, Pune, and Singapore and remote-based colleagues everywhere in between.                Our inclusive, collaborative culture sets us apart and makes CellPoint Digital a truly special place to join and apply your talent. We believe in the power of community, in bringing out the best in one another, in working cross-functionally and across borders to create something extraordinary for our clients and our partners.                We want teammates who will rally around our mission and around each other - with a steadfast commitment to consistently demonstrating heart and hustle, enthusiasm and excellence, ingenuity, and integrity.               We are looking for best-in-class talent to join our community and help us accomplish something extraordinary as we transform the payments industry.                  Database Developer                         We re currently seeking a developer with a minimum of 3 years of experience in database related projects to join our team as a Database Developer.                  You will be a part of a talented and excellent software development team, and will be responsible for working on projects that are currently being developed by our company.                   How You Will Make an Impact:                 Act as a technical resource to undertake Database Development, Maintenance, Deployment and Support of all the CPD Data warehouse/Database environments.         Undertake Database Development tasks as per the sprint plans.         Troubleshoot database problems in all the Data warehouse environments, perform root cause analysis resolve issues as per the priorities.         Coordinate with different teams to address technical/functional issues.         Participate in the product user story walk through, internal team discussions sprints.         Contribute towards all routine operational activities of the Data warehouse systems.                   Skills you will have fine-tuned:                 Hands-on experience with any of the leading Database management systems vizOracle,SQL-Server, etc         Experience on Postgres database systems is an added advantage         Strong expertise in Database Development          Proficient in SQL coding         Demonstrated experience in Database SQL Optimization/Performance Tuning         Proven experience with Database Programming languages viz., PL/SQL, PL/pgSQL,T-SQL,etc.         Sound knowledge on Big-data/Hadoop, Kafka, Map-Reduce programming, NoSQL,etc. would be a plus         Open to learning, adopting and scaling any data centric technologies as per the evolving organizational product strategies.         Ability to troubleshoot Database related issues         Experience on Data Warehouse projects, and Data Analytics/Reporting/ETL or sound knowledge on these concepts would be a plus         You are eager to bring your unique talents and authenticity to the CellPoint Digital community.          Youre constantly curious and a lifetime learner.         You have excellent communication and relationship-building skills.         You enjoy leading and supporting cross-functional initiatives and projects in a team where you are empowered and accountable.         You thrive in a fast-paced environment and the challenge of managing multiple projects simultaneously while prioritizing high-return work.         You approach challenges with a solution-oriented mindset.         You are able to thrive in a remote first arrangement with a distributed organization in multiple time zones.                     Whats in it for you:             We offer you the opportunity to be an innovator, challenge the status quo, and redefine the payments category         Competitive salary in a fast-growing start-up         Medical insurance with coverage for dependents (parents, spouse, children)         Rewards and recognition program         Flexible hybrid work model; were a fully distributed company, and we provide the tools, culture, and support to make your work setup work for you                     More About CellPoint Digital:             Our roots are in innovating payment for the airline industry, but we are quickly transforming other verticals including gaming, e-commerce, and marketplaces.          Our customers include some of the leading brands you know, including Virgin Atlantic, Southwest Airlines, Avianca, but also cutting-edge and emerging brands like MTCGame, a global e-commerce platform for video gamers - and Hoppa, a ground transportation service in the UK.         We are recognized as a true innovator and were selected to be part of Plug and Play Tech Centre s Innovation Incubator and identified as the Top Fintech company for 2022 by CIOReview Magazine.         Proud Member of the Merchant Risk Council, the leading global trade association for eCommerce fraud and payments professionals, as well as leading organizations within the airline industry including the International Air Transport Association (IATA), the Center for Aviation (CAPA), and the Latin American and Caribbean Air Transport Association (ALTA)         We believe in doing the right thing for our planet and have received CarbonNeutral certification from the Carbon Neutral Company, the global standard in helping companies achieve carbon neutrality by calculating a carbon footprint and reducing it to zero through a combination of in-house efficiency measures and external emission reduction project support.
column11: Performance tuning, Aviation, project support, Relationship building, Database, PLSQL, Medical insurance, Gaming, Operations, Data warehousing

column2: As an ODI (Oracle Data Integrator) Apex Admin, you will be responsible for managing and administering the Oracle Data Integrator platform, particularly focusing on Apex components. You will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth functioning of data integration processes, optimizing performance, and troubleshooting issues within the ODI Apex environment. This position demands expertise in Oracle Data Integrator, Apex development, and strong analytical skills to understand complex data integration requirements and deliver efficient solutions.           Key Responsibilities:           Administer the Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) platform, including installation, configuration, and maintenance of ODI servers and components.         Manage and monitor ODI Apex instances, ensuring optimal performance and availability.         Design, develop, and implement ODI Apex solutions for data integration, transformation, and loading processes.         Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions within the ODI Apex environment.         Perform troubleshooting, debugging, and resolution of issues related to ODI Apex configurations, workflows, and data transformations.         Implement best practices for ODI Apex development, version control, and deployment processes.         Provide technical guidance and support to developers and end-users on ODI Apex functionality, usage, and best practices.         Conduct performance tuning and optimization of ODI Apex processes to ensure efficient data integration and processing.         Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in Oracle Data Integrator and Apex technologies, and evaluate their applicability to enhance existing systems and processes.         Document ODI Apex configurations, workflows, and solutions, and maintain comprehensive documentation for reference and knowledge sharing.           Required Skills and Qualifications:           Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.         Proven experience working as an ODI Administrator or ODI Developer with expertise in managing and administering ODI environments.         Strong proficiency in Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) toolset, including knowledge of ODI Studio, Topology Manager, and ODI Console.         Hands-on experience with Oracle APEX (Application Express) development and administration.         Proficiency in SQL and PL/SQL for data manipulation, querying, and scripting within the Oracle database environment.         Solid understanding of data integration concepts, ETL processes, and data warehousing principles.         Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex issues and propose effective solutions.         Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.         Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, prioritize tasks, and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

column2: Database Administration:              Design, implement, and maintain SQL Server databases on the Azure platform.             Manage database schemas, tables, indexes, and stored procedures.             Perform routine database maintenance tasks, including backups, restores, and data integrity checks.             Monitor database performance and proactively optimize SQL queries and server configurations.             Ensure data security and compliance with industry standards and organizational policies.     Azure Integration:              Work with Azure services such as Azure SQL Database, Azure VMs, Azure Blob Storage, and Azure Key Vault to support database operations.             Implement and manage Azure database features like Azure SQL Elastic Pools, Managed Instances, and geo-replication for high availability.     Performance Tuning:              Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks through query optimization, indexing, and server configuration adjustments.             Monitor and analyze database performance metrics and implement solutions to improve efficiency.     High Availability and Disaster Recovery:              Implement and manage database redundancy and failover solutions to ensure high availability.             Develop and maintain disaster recovery plans and conduct regular tests.     Security and Compliance:              Implement security measures to protect sensitive data, including encryption, access controls, and auditing.             Ensure compliance with industry regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA) and internal security policies.     Automation and Scripting:              Automate routine database tasks using PowerShell, Azure Automation, or other scripting languages.             Create and maintain infrastructure as code (IaC) for database provisioning and configuration.     Monitoring and Alerts:              Set up and configure monitoring tools to detect and respond to database issues.             Establish alerting thresholds and notifications for critical events.     Documentation and Training:              Maintain detailed documentation of database configurations, procedures, and best practices.             Provide training and mentorship to junior database administrators and IT staff.           Qualifications:              Bachelor s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field (or equivalent experience).             Extensive experience (5+ years) as a SQL Server Database Administrator.             Microsoft Azure certification (e.g., Azure Database Administrator Associate) is highly desirable.             Proficiency in T-SQL scripting and database design principles.             Strong knowledge of database performance tuning and optimization.             Experience with PowerShell scripting and automation.             Familiarity with Azure services and cloud-based database management.             Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.             Strong communication and teamwork skills.             Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.

column2: Job description Please apply to the below link: https://centroid.applytojob.com/apply/F2O7xcWl35/Oracle-Linux-Administrator-Full-Time   Job Title: Oracle Linux Administrator - Full Time Oracle Linux Administrator is going to perform systems management in conjunction with Oracle Linux systems administration, database, application, and networking teams. Install and Support Virtualization products - i.e. KVM, Oracle VM Knowledge in Oracle ZFS storage appliance (or similar) Support automate processes and maintain the application and OS environments. Ability to make sound decisions in a manner consistent with the essential job functions. Ability to communicate technical information effectively, both orally and in writing. Experience with Shell scripting. column2: Project Role : Software Development Engineer Project Role Description : Analyze, design, code and test multiple components of application code across one or more clients. Perform maintenance, enhancements and/or development work.  Must have skills : Oracle Database Administration Good to have skills : NA Minimum  2  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : 15 years of full time education Summary :As an Oracle Database Administrator, you will be responsible for analyzing, designing, coding, testing, and maintaining multiple components of application code across one or more clients. Your typical day will involve performing maintenance, enhancements, and development work using your expertise in Oracle Database Administration.  Roles & Responsibilities: Design, install, configure, and maintain Oracle databases, ensuring their performance, security, and availability. Develop and implement backup and recovery procedures, ensuring data integrity and recoverability. Monitor database performance, identifying and resolving issues proactively, and optimizing database performance. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, system administrators, and project managers, to ensure the successful delivery of projects. Provide technical support and guidance to end-users, including troubleshooting and resolving database-related issues. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Expertise in Oracle Database Administration. Good To Have Skills:Knowledge of other database technologies such as MySQL, SQL Server, and PostgreSQL. Experience in database backup and recovery procedures. Strong understanding of database performance tuning and optimization techniques. Experience in database security and access control. Knowledge of database monitoring and alerting tools. Experience in database migration and upgrade procedures. Solid grasp of database design principles and normalization techniques. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 2 years of experience in Oracle Database Administration. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, information technology, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful database solutions. This position is based at our Bengaluru office.

column2: ?         We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Database Engineer with expertise in Informatica and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to join our dynamic team.          As a Database Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and managing our complex database systems, ensuring optimal data integrity, performance, and security.          You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to deliver scalable solutions and contribute to the success of our organization.               Responsibilities:           Design, develop, and implement efficient and scalable database solutions using Informatica PowerCenter and other ETL tools.             Perform data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes, ensuring the accuracy and integrity of data.             Develop and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and functions to support data manipulation and reporting requirements.             Conduct data modelling and schema design to optimize database performance and meet business needs.             Collaborate with stakeholders and business analysts to gather and analyse requirements for database projects.             Monitor and fine-tune database performance, identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks and inefficiencies.             Implement data quality checks, validation rules, and data governance processes to ensure data accuracy and consistency.             Lead data migration and integration initiatives, ensuring the seamless transfer of data from legacy systems to new databases.             Collaborate with security teams to implement robust data security measures, including user access controls and encryption mechanisms.             Troubleshoot and resolve database-related issues, ensuring minimal downtime and optimal system performance.             Stay updated with the latest industry trends and advancements in database technologies, providing recommendations for continuous improvement.             Create and maintain technical documentation, including database schemas, data flow diagrams, and process workflows.             Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including developers, analysts, and system administrators, to deliver high-quality solutions.               Qualifications:           Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.             Proven experience as a Database Engineer or similar role, with a strong focus on Informatica and ETL processes.             Solid understanding of Database Management Systems, such as Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL, and MongoDB.             Proficiency in Informatica PowerCenter and Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) for ETL processes.             Strong SQL programming skills, including query optimization and performance tuning.             Familiarity with data warehousing concepts, dimensional modelling, and schema design.             Knowledge of data migration and integration techniques, including ETL best practices.             Experience in data quality management, data governance, and data security.             Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve database issues.             Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.             Strong organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks and priorities.             Relevant certifications in Informatica, ETL, or Database Management Systems (e.g., Informatica Certified Developer, Oracle Database Administrator Certification) are a plus.

column2: ETL Development - The CDP ETL Database Engineer will be responsible for building pipelines to feed? downstream data processes     They will have the ability to analyze data, interpret business requirements, and establish relationships between data sets     The ideal candidate will be familiar with different encoding formats    and file layouts such as JSON and XML     Implementations Onboarding - Will work with the team to onboard new clients onto the ZMP/CDP+? platform     The candidate will solidify business requirements, perform ETL file validation, establish users, perform complex aggregations, and syndicate data across platforms     The hands-on engineer will take a test-driven approach towards development and will be able to document processes and workflows     Incremental Change Requests- The CDP ETL Database Engineer will be responsible for analyzing change? requests and determining the best approach towards implementation and execution of the request     This requires the engineer to have a deep understanding of the overall architecture of the platform     Change requests will be implemented and tested in a development environment to ensure the introduction of change will not have a negative impact on downstream processes     Change Data Management - The candidate will adhere to change data management procedures and actively participate in CAB meetings where change requests will be presented and approved     Prior to introducing change, the engineer will ensure that processes are running in a development environment     The engineer will be asked to do peer to peer code reviews as well as solution reviews prior to production code deployment     Collaboration Process Improvement - The engineer will be asked to participate in knowledge share sessions where they will engage with peers, discuss solutions, best practices, overall approach, and process     The candidate will be able to look for opportunities to streamline processes with an eye towards building a repeatable model to reduce implementation duration             Job Requirements:         The CDP ETL Database Engineer will be well versed in the following areas:       Relational data modeling     ETL and FTP concepts      Advanced Analytics using SQL Functions      Cloud technologies - AWS, Snowflake        Able to decipher requirements, provide recommendations, and implement solutions within predefined timeframes.      The ability to work independently, but at the same time, the individual will be called upon to contribute in a?team setting.      The engineer will be able to confidently communicate status, raise exceptions, and voice concerns to their direct manager.     Participate in internal client project status meetings with the     Solution/ Delivery management teams.     When required, collaborate with the Business Solutions Analyst (BSA) to solidify requirements. column2: We are seeking an experienced Senior Database Engineer with a strong foundation in both traditional relational databases (SQL) and modern NoSQLdatabase systems     The ideal candidate will excel in optimizing SQL queries,    designing efficient database schemas, and implementing scalable NoSQL solutions     This role is critical for ensuring the highest levels of    performance, scalability, and data availability across our diverse data storage environments     This role requires a deep understanding of database structures, theories, best practices, and a proactive approach to database management         Responsibilities:       * Analyze and optimize SQL queries for maximum efficiency and performance.    * Proficiency in ORM frameworks and understanding of transaction management in ORM, including concepts of transactions at the application level versus the database level.    * Knowledge of how to optimize queries in an ORM context, understanding the N+1 problem, and other common performance pitfalls in ORM usage.    * Skills in profiling and debugging ORM queries to ensure they perform    efficiently against the database.    * Ability to refactor and rewrite stored procedures as application-level code    using the chosen programming language.    * Develop and optimize NoSQL database models to efficiently store, query, and manage unstructured or semi-structured data.    * Conduct regular performance tests and identify bottlenecks in database    systems and make recommendations for hardware or software updates as needed.    * Work closely with the development teams to advise on database best    practices, query optimization, and schema refinement.    * Develop and maintain documentation regarding database configurations,    architectures, and best practices.    * Stay current with the latest database technologies, trends, and best    practices to continuously improve database performance and reliability.        Requirements:       * bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related    field.    * Proven experience in database design, performance tuning, and optimization, with a strong emphasis on SQL query optimization.    * Expert knowledge of SQL and experience with at least one of the major SQL databases (eg, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQL Server) and NoSQL databases (eg, MongoDB, Cassandra, DynamoDB, CockroachDB).    * Strong working knowledge of cloud based database services like AWS RDS, Amazon Aurora, OCI MySQL HeatWave Database service.    * Deep understanding of database principles, including normalization, table    partitioning, and indexing strategies.    * Experience in monitoring and tuning databases to ensure high levels of    performance and availability.    * Familiarity with database profiling tools and techniques.    * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.    * Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.    * Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced    environment.        What We Offer:           Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.     Opportunity to work with cutting-edge database technologies.     A supportive and collaborative team environment.     Professional development and career growth opportunities.

column2: Role & responsibilities   A professional Database Developer will keep the database running smoothly 24/7 to provide a seamless flow of information throughout the platform & related applications, considering both backend data structure and frontend accessibility for end-users. The specific job responsibilities are: Work in close coordination with the IT team to understand the existing architecture, and to use the same for the development of the new application Build database systems of high availability and quality depending on each end user's specialised role Design and implement a database in accordance with end users information needs and views Define users and enable data distribution to the right user, in the appropriate format and in a timely manner Use high-speed transaction recovery techniques and backup data Minimise database downtime and manage parameters to provide fast query responses Provide proactive and reactive data management support and training to users Determine, enforce and document database policies, procedures and standards Monitor database performance, implement changes and apply new patches and versions when required Provide technical and operational support for Database Servers, including logical and physical database design support, troubleshooting, performance monitoring, tuning, and optimizing. Responsible for regular maintenance of databases (e.g., Vacuum, Reindexing, Archiving). Responsible for proactive remediation of database operational problems. Responsible for Query tuning and preventative maintenance. Undertake any other activities/tasks as assigned by the supervisors. Preferred candidate profile   Proven working experience as a Database Developer Hands-on with database standards and end-user applications Excellent knowledge of data backup, recovery, security, integrity and SQL Familiarity with database design, documentation, and coding Familiarity with programming languages API Problem-solving skills and ability to think algorithmically Hands-on with PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQL Developer, PGADMIN, DBeaver, Putty and Jasper Reports and other tools. Language Skills Excellent knowledge of written and spoken English and  knowledge of at least one other national language will be an asset. Position:  PL SQL developer Location:  Noida Mandatory skills:  PLSQL Exp :  4- 7yrs (Only) You can register by sharing your CV, Notice period and Expected CTC to  9363648148   Whatsapp  for immediate response (Dont call-Will be occupied in meetings)  . Note: We are not considering candidates less than 4years experience in PL SQL and notice period higher than 7  days are not considered. Relocation candidates are not considered. Job Description: We are seeking a talented and motivated  5+ Years experienced PL/SQL Develope r. The candidate will play a key role in  designing, developing, and maintaining database solutions using PL/SQL.  Responsibilities:        Oracle - Design, develop, and optimize complex SQL queries and PL/SQL code for database applications.             Create and maintain stored procedures, functions, triggers, and packages to support business requirements.             Perform database performance tuning, query optimization, and troubleshooting.             Collaborate with front-end developers to integrate database applications with user interfaces.             Work closely with data architects and database administrators to ensure data integrity.             Participate in code reviews to ensure code quality, performance, and adherence to coding standards.             Analyze and understand business requirements to translate them into technical solutions.             Provide technical support and resolve issues related to database systems and applications.             Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends in database development. Qualifications:             Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.             Proven experience as a PL/SQL Developer or Database Developer.             Proficiency in writing complex SQL queries and developing PL/SQL code.             Strong understanding of relational database concepts and database design principles.             Experience with performance tuning and query optimization techniques.             Familiarity with Oracle database systems is must.             Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.             Strong communication and teamwork skills.             Ability to work in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.
