column2: The mission of the DBA Lead, Oracle Applications is to support the architecting, provisioning, configuring, scaling, and bench marking multiple clusters and environments of Oracle eBusiness Suite (EBS)     You should be Oracle database Performance tuning expert     You will plan, coordinate, develop, implement and support database solutions, including database definition, structure, replication strategies, documentation, requirements, guidelines and security     You will troubleshoot technical issues related to Oracle database, applications and assist with the oversight and guidance of junior to mid-level DBAs     Additionally, you will provide technical leadership to fellow Application DBAs (external and Internal) and create/enforce EBS standards                 Why join Stryker       Our total rewards package offering includes bonuses, healthcare, insurance benefits, retirement programs, wellness programs, as well as service and performance awards - not to mention various social and recreational activities, all of which are location specific.       Who we want:           Analytical problem solvers.    People who go beyond just fixing issues to identify root causes, evaluate optimal solutions, and recommend comprehensive upgrades to prevent future issues.       Strategic thinkers.    People who enjoy analyzing data or trends for the purposes of planning, forecasting, advising, budgeting, reporting.       Collaborative partners.    People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, data and insights to drive continuous improvement in functions.         What you will do:         Perform advanced database tuning and performance monitoring including indexing, reorganizations and partitioning.     Perform advanced database troubleshooting as needed.     Design, implement and enforce user access security models.     Creation, enforcement and review of database standards to ensure that all application design and code is produced with proper integrity, security and performance     Act as database technical lead, guiding and mentoring Junior and Mid-Level DBA s (Oracle Applications DBA).     Working knowledge of SOX controls, ability to understand and automate data collection for SOX controls.     Troubleshoot poor performing advanced database packages, procedures, functions and triggers as required and able to suggest performance improvements     Create, implement and maintain both logical and physical database design.             What you will need:         Advanced understanding of the Oracle database, related utilities and tools, physical database design     Advanced knowledge of Oracle database tuning and performance monitoring, Oracle security management, Oracle data integrity, Oracle RAC and Data Guard     Advanced knowledge of GoldenGate replication     Solid experience using SQL, SQL Plus and PL/SQL     Good understanding of the Unix operating system     Proven leadership skills, problem-solving ability and ability to work with multiple deadlines     At least 10 years of professional experience in IT with at least 6 years of experience on Oracle DB 11g or 12c, with certification     At least 8 years of experience as hands on Application DBA on Oracle eBusiness Suite, with 11i or R12 version, with Finance, Operation or SCM modules     At least 8 years of experience in ERP Production support, should be able to lead the support project along with 1-2 team members , Should be able to take informed decision and run the system independently      Experience in Production mode administration like System administration     Experience of an EBS implementation and implementation with AIX is a plus     Strong Troubleshooting skills and must have very good conceptual knowledge of Oracle Database     Exposure to SOX and FDA audit and compliance procedures     Exposure to international / medical companies

column2: We are seeking for a highly skilled and motivated MS SQL Database Engineer with a strong sense of creativity. As an MS SQL Database Engineer, you will work directly with clients, gathering requirements to align technology with business strategy and goals, and bringing in specialists from both within and outside the company for deep functional or industry expertise, domain knowledge, or providing expertise. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to deliver scalable solutions and contribute to the success of our organization.  Role & responsibilities: 3+ years of experience working with MS SQL Database Development. Experience in complex MS SQL development and performance tuning. Experience in logical and physical database design specific to MS SQL. Understanding of database normalization concepts. Collaborate with security teams to implement robust data security measures, including user access controls and encryption mechanisms. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and advancements in MS SQL database technologies, providing recommendations for continuous improvement. Conduct data modeling and schema design to optimize MS SQL database performance and meet business needs. Lead data migration and integration initiatives, ensuring the seamless transfer of data from legacy systems to new MS SQL databases.
